Pretty on-point.

Especially his WoW analogie at ~150, "You had to use you're cooldowns in a **smart** way to get the result that you wanted"
I feel like that was the case in lol aswell, We had some high impact high CD spells, tanky targets were actually tanky enough to not just pop if you throw everything on them, you head to hold back some skills and wait for the right moment. The skill on a tank like Alistar was no to get the W+Q combo right, it was to know when NOT to go for that combo, knowing when to hold back.

And right now, or actually since S6, this no longer is the case. CDs are generally so low on new designs and through overabundance on CDR that many things are best used if spammed to max uptime/dps becuase riot wants players to "have more buttons to press in a fight" - a fundamentaly stupid reason in a strategic and tactical game, it shouldn't be about pressing many buttons fast, it should be about pressing the right button in the right situation at the right time.  
The other big issue is that TTK is so low that you basically have to dumb your entier kit imidiatly, or the fight is over befor you get a chance to use you're shit. Either you go instanly all-out and burst down you're opponent first, or you won't get a chance to go all-out. There is no time to wait for openenings, sneak around for flanks, setup combos, you either take em down in a blazeing flash of madness, or they take you down that way.
Honestly I think league should start to die so another MOBA can grow and learn from RIOT's mistakes and fill the viod in the genre

I personally also don't like the high damage meta where its basically "cc and focus and blow up" but whats more important is the stuff he says about community attitude
